text: India is the world's largest democracy, operating under a parliamentary system of government with a President as the head of state and a Prime Minister as the head of government.
The executive power is vested in the Prime Minister and their Council of Ministers, who are responsible for day-to-day governance and are drawn from the majority party or coalition in the Lok Sabha.
The President of India is the ceremonial head of state and the supreme commander of the Indian Armed Forces, elected by an electoral college for a five-year term.
The current and 15th President of India is Smt. Droupadi Murmu, who made history as the first tribal woman and the second woman ever to hold this esteemed office.
The Vice President of India is the second-highest constitutional office and serves as the ex-officio Chairman of the Rajya Sabha. The current Vice President is Shri Jagdeep Dhankhar.

The current Prime Minister of India is Shri Narendra Modi of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). He is the 14th PM and has been serving since May 26, 2014, leading the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) coalition.
Prime Minister Narendra Modi represents the parliamentary constituency of Varanasi in Uttar Pradesh in the Lok Sabha.
Shri Amit Shah is the current Union Minister of Home Affairs. He is a senior leader of the BJP and is considered one of the most powerful ministers in the Modi government.
Shri Rajnath Singh serves as the current Union Minister of Defence. He is a former President of the BJP and a key strategic member of the Union Cabinet.
Smt. Nirmala Sitharaman is the current Union Minister of Finance and Corporate Affairs. She is the first full-time female Finance Minister of India.
Dr. S. Jaishankar is the current Union Minister of External Affairs. A former Foreign Secretary and career diplomat, he is a central figure in managing India's international relations.
The ruling coalition at the center is the National Democratic Alliance (NDA), led by the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). It includes several other regional and national parties.
The current National President of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) is Shri Jagat Prakash Nadda (J.P. Nadda).
The principal opposition party in the Lok Sabha is the Indian National Congress (INC), led by President Shri Mallikarjun Kharge.
A significant bloc of opposition parties has formed a coalition known as the Indian National Developmental Inclusive Alliance (I.N.D.I.A.) to contest the ruling NDA in national elections.
The Lok Sabha, or House of the People, is the lower house of India's Parliament. Its members are directly elected by the people for a term of five years.
The Lok Sabha has a maximum strength of 550 members, with 530 representing states and 20 representing union territories. The provision for nominating Anglo-Indian members has been abolished.
The Honourable Speaker of the 18th Lok Sabha is Shri Om Birla, who was re-elected to the position unanimously in June 2024.
The Rajya Sabha, or Council of States, is the upper house of Parliament. It is a permanent body not subject to dissolution, with one-third of its members retiring every two years.
The Rajya Sabha has a maximum strength of 250 members. 238 are elected by state and territorial legislatures, and 12 are nominated by the President for their expertise in specific fields.
The Chief Minister of India's most populous state, Uttar Pradesh, is Shri Yogi Adityanath of the BJP. He has been in office since March 19, 2017.
The Chief Minister of Maharashtra is Shri Eknath Shinde. He leads a coalition government formed by his faction of Shiv Sena and the BJP.
The Chief Minister of the National Capital Territory of Delhi is Shri Arvind Kejriwal, who is also the national convener of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP).
The Chief Minister of West Bengal is Smt. Mamata Banerjee. She is the founder and chairperson of the All India Trinamool Congress (TMC) party.
The Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu is Thiru M.K. Stalin of the Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) party, who has been in office since May 2021.
The Supreme Court of India is the apex judicial body. The current Chief Justice of India (CJI) is Justice Dhananjaya Y. Chandrachud.
The Election Commission of India (ECI) is an autonomous constitutional authority responsible for administering election processes. The current Chief Election Commissioner is Shri Rajiv Kumar.
India successfully held the presidency of the G20 (Group of Twenty) in 2023, hosting the annual summit in New Delhi under the theme 'Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam' (One Earth, One Family, One Future).
